definition: meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near

sentences.english: I am weak from my youth in the horse over.

sentences.english: Do you ever feel, feel so paper-thin?

He often wore a simple vest and a cylindrical, tasseled hat.

sentences.english: She doesn't love dressing up, this makes her in beautiful, very thin.
sentences.chinese: 她不爱打扮，这又使她在花枝招展中，格外单薄。

sentences.english: As a thin and weak individual, comparing with whole collectivity, I'm not important.

sentences.english: The boundary between the wet asphalt and metal material is very fragile.

sentences.english: I have a round face and my too thin brows added weight to my face.

sentences.english: The View layer is thin and supplies no business logic.

sentences.english: He was underdressed for the hiking trip and suffered hypothermia.

definition: obese/bloated/swollen (style)/(fig.) (of an organization) oversized or overstaffed
